page.title: 05Acklington Agricult'l Garage
page.content:
{Acklington Garage}is owned by I.& M. Pearson. It is a garage which chiefly deals with agricultural repairs and supplies. Until recently it was also a petrol filling station, but poor sales meant that this service was stopped.
There are{9 workers}(4 from Alnwick, 3 from Acklington and 2 from Amble) including 2 ladies who work in the office. The youngest worker is aged 16
The garage is very well supported (especially in the summer) by local farmers who buy, or rent, the various {machinery.}Most of the machinery comes from the Continent and includes: fertilizer spinners from Belgium, balers from France, harrows from Italy, tractors from Germany, harvesters from Denmark as well as trailers and gates from the U.K.
